intro: Diectomis fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered diectomis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Dipterocarpaceae, which includes many tropical trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its clustered growth habit and small, inconspicuous flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth surface, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
